Phenols have antioxidant properties, so they scavenge and reduce reactive oxygen species (ROS), thereby preventing the oxidation of vital biomolecules of cells and avoiding oxidative stress and/or mitigating its impacts on plant cells
59 . Flavonoids possess a variety of therapeutic, biological, and pharmaceutical properties and act as antioxidants, anti-inflammation, anti-platelet, anti-thrombotic and anti-allergic
60 .
